member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteWindowless.DeactivateAndUndo
member.summary: Deactivates the object, ends the in-place session, and reverts to the container's saved undo state.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteWindowless.DiscardUndoState
member.summary: Instructs the container to discard its undo state. The container should not call .

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteWindowless.OnPosRectChange
member.summary: Notifies the container that the object extents have changed.
member.param: A pointer a structure that contains the position of the in-place object in the client coordinates of its parent window.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteWindowless.OnUIDeactivate
member.summary: Notifies the container that it should reinstall its user interface and take focus, and whether the object has an undoable state.
member.param: Specifies whether the object can undo changes (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteWindowless.Scroll
member.summary: Instructs the container to scroll the view of the object by the specified number of pixels.
member.param: The number of pixels by which to scroll in the X and Y directions.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The specified pointer is not valid.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteWindowless.ContextSensitiveHelp
member.summary: Determines whether context-sensitive help mode should be entered during an in-place activation session.
member.param: TRUE if help mode should be entered; FALSE if it should be exited.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK if the help mode was entered or exited successfully, depending on the value passed in fEnterMode. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The specified fEnterMode value is not valid.
There is insufficient memory available for this operation.
